page.title: 20 SHEEN TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: A traffic survey was carried out at the junction of Upper Richmond Road with Sheen Lane. Both routes are feeder roads for the main commuter routes into London, the South Circular and the Chertsey Road. We found that the Upper Richmond Road was busier, with 320 cars, 100 heavy lorries and 20 buses over a 40 minute period. Traffics lights were phased to allow for the extra traffic. A lack of public carparks was noticed. Waitrose, Safeways, the railway station, the library and the pub provided carparks only for their customers. Yellow lines restricted parking between 8.30 am and 6 pm on the Upper Richmond Road. This leads to congestion, especially in Sheen Lane. Pedestrians are poorly catered for, with only 2 zebra crossings in a mile area.
